title: Is it true that the habit of book reading changes your way of thinking? - Quora

response.answer_text: Does it? There is no doubt!  Ever since you start to pick up that children's books that contains numerous pictures, your brain goes into a constant attempt of understanding and creating situations that go with the book. And by the time you pick up a J. K. Rowling, your imagination gets to new levels of interpretation, you learn new vocabulary, you experience a whole different kind of pleasure, your brain formulated conclusions and expresses ideas, and most importantly, you learn how to pronounce 'Hermione'. As I see it, there are 5 different kinds of changes that one experiences from reading.  Emotional : ‘The Fault In Our Stars'It allows us to give a deeper understanding of emotions through pain we haven't felt, through stories that leave our heart pure and empathetic, knowing we should be able to go past our troubles, however big or small they may seem.  2. Intrigue : 'Sherlock Holmes' Crime thrillers that make use of words efficiently making it suspenseful improvises our thrill factor enormously. A deep depiction makes us wonder how plots fit together and enables our brain to look deeper into situations we face.  3. Flaws : ‘The God of Small Things From the days of Pride and Prejudice the world has been made aware of the discrimination that plagues the unfortunate sectors of society. We have come to know of instances of patriarchy, slavery, communalism, racism, dictatorship, inequality, homophobia, animal injustice, and the other unmentioned issues that exist in every region. This simply brings in us a better human being capable of making more meaning than just watching crimes from a distance.  4. Historical : ‘Sapiens' The books that let's us process humongous amounts of information, and most of the time, in a highly captivating manner. The best thing about this is, our brain develops everytime we learn something new. Our understanding of the world around us, how it came to how it is now, always leave a mindprint for all our endeavours.  5. Motivational : ‘How to win friends and to influence people ' Everyone could do with some help, at any given point of their lives. They need to cope up with tragedies from time to time, and these books provide just the required amount of help to get us out of these situations. We keep thinking about how differently we can perceive what happens around us, and how to make the best out of given situations. The irreplaceable books have the power of making us feel better about ourselves, by making us feel through its world and let's us live there for a while. They are our companions and their authors keep leading our hearts towards the greater good. If you feel like you could include more categories of books that introduces in depth thinking changes, feel free to comment.

Totally! And it doesn’t matter what you read. Most of the books I read are YA, so now, if I talk to someone, I can relate to their problems even if I haven’t experienced them. I can also make friends with people even if I don’t agree with their worldview. So, yeah, it definitely changes the way you think and the way you see the world.
